addressleaf.section:
To
e right honorable S
r
Robert Cecill knight of her Hig
es
privy Councel

13 Julij
1594.
M
r
Bodley to my M
r
From the Haghe
Newes from
Deventer
of the surrendring of
Groninghen

page.lettertext:
fol.35r
May it please yo
r
H. Presently upon the
sealing of my for mer, we had intelligence from De-
venter
at Groeninghen surrendred
e 10 of this
moneth, whiche is not yet signified from
e Campe
unto us: but we expect it every houre, and in
e
meane season we hold
e newes to be very certaine.
It is a singular victorie for
e good of these contreis,
whose union is
e stronger, by an other entier, and
very riche Province, suche as will have
e meanes, and
that very shortly, to contribut to
e warres as muche
as
Zelande
or
Friseland.
And thus I take my
humble leave. From
e Hage. July 13
Yo
r
H. at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley
